alert.note: Alert for Adams; Idaho; Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued December 27 at 7:58AM MST by NWS Boise
info.description: The following message is transmitted at the request of the Payette National Forest Avalanche Center. ...The Payette National Forest Avalanche Center in McCall Idaho has issued a BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WARNING... * WHAT...The avalanche danger for the warning area will rise to HIGH today and tonight. * WHERE...in the West Central Idaho Mountains, and the Valley County-Payette Avalanche Center advisory area near McCall. * WHEN...in effect from Tuesday, December 27,2022 - 6:00 AM to Wednesday, December 28,2022 - 6:00 AM. * IMPACTS...Rain has been falling for the past 24 hours up to 7000 feet, heavy wet snow and strong winds above 7000 feet will likely create widespread areas of unstable snow. Wet avalanches are likely at lower and middle elevations and dry avalanches are likely at middle and upper elevations. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Very dangerous avalanche conditions. Travel in avalanche terrain is not recommended. Natural avalanches are likely and human- triggered avalanches are very likely. Avalanches may run long distances and can run into mature forests, valley floors, or flat terrain. Consult WWW.PAYETTEAVALANCHE.ORG or WWW.AVALANCHE.ORG for more detailed information. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.
